content:
Configure the Social Conversations Component

Use the Lightning App Builder to set up the Social Conversations component.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Social Customer Service is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Service Setup is available in Lightning Experience.
Social Customer Service is available in all editions with the Service Cloud.

IMPORTANT Effective May 3, 2022, the Social Customer Service Starter Pack is no longer available to customers who haven't previously enabled this feature.

Social Customer Service must be enabled.

From the agent console, click Edit Page, which takes you to the Lightning App Builder.
Enter Social Conversations in the Quick Find box, and navigate to the component.
Drag the Social Conversations component to the right side of the Lightning App Builder. A three-column layout is recommended, with the Social Conversations component on the right.

Make sure that agents who use the Social Conversations component have Read Access permission on all fields on the Social Persona and Case objects.

Set field level security.
To ensure that agents have the correct field-level security, set the Social Persona and Social Post objects. All conversations component users need this post visibility.
From Service Setup, enter Channels in the Quick Find box, then select Social Customer Service. Under Settings, select the options that meet your needs.

To ensure that posts are approved before they are sent, select Enable approvals for social posts.
To map new posts to the parent post, which is the post that generated the case, select Enable retrieval of parent posts for added context.

Set component visibility filters.
To ensure that Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube posts are properly displayed in the conversations component, setting component visibility filters is recommended.
From the agent console, return to the Lightning App Builder.
Under Set Component Visibility, click Add filter, then set the Field to Case Origin.
Create 4 filters, one for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube.

NOTE To display parent posts in the component, enable the org setting Enable retrieval of parent posts for added context. Parent posts don’t display when this option isn’t selected.
title: Configuring Social Customer Service
